As Damian conversed with the members of the Teen Titans, he felt the urge to withdraw and hide his emotions. The pain from his broken nose still lingered, but he didn't want to reveal his vulnerability to his teammates.

"So, have you guys settled in?" he asked, trying to keep the conversation going.

"Yeah, we're starting to get used to the new headquarters," said Kid Flash.

"It's pretty cool. The technology is so much better than the old base," added Raven.

"Good to hear," Damian replied, trying not to show his discomfort. "We have a lot of work to do, so let's get to it."

As they started to talk about their next mission, Damian couldn't help but feel a tinge of sadness. He missed his old teammates and the bond they had. But he also knew he couldn't dwell on the past and had to focus on the present.

Just then, his phone rang. He saw that it was Jon's number and hesitated for a moment before answering. "Hello?"

"Hey, Damian. It's Jon," came the voice on the other end.

Damian braced himself for an apology, or worse, more taunts about his broken nose. "What do you want, Jon?" he asked, trying to keep his voice even.

"I just wanted to check in and see how you're doing," Jon said. "I know I messed up last week and I'm sorry about that."

Damian was surprised at the genuine tone of Jon's voice. "I'm fine," he replied curtly. "It's just a broken nose."

There was a pause on the other end of the line before Jon spoke again. "I know you're still angry with me, but I hope we can still be friends. We've been through a lot together."

Damian felt a twinge of guilt at Jon's words. He had been holding a grudge against him, but he knew deep down that he missed their friendship too. "I don't know, Jon," he said hesitantly. "You really hurt me last week."

"I know," Jon said. "And I'm sorry. I was out of line. But I promise, I won't do anything like that again. Can we start over?"

Damian paused for a moment, considering Jon's offer. He missed their adventures together and the bond they had formed. "Okay, Jon," he said finally. "We can start over. But you have to promise to never do anything like that again."

"I promise," Jon said. "Thanks, Damian. I knew I could count on you."

The call ended, and Damian felt a sense of relief and a flicker of hope that things could be different between them. But he also knew that their relationship wouldn't be the same as before. He still had doubts and questions about his place in the world and his role in the Teen Titans.

Okay, have the call not end up, and have Damian ask how Jon is doing and have him talking a mile a minute about praying for him and his parents concern, and then asking questions about faith just like Damian was, and then going to church and meeting people from smallville. Have Damian barely able to get a word in edgewise and not show much on the outside but have it meaningful and stirring him iup on the inside.

Jon continues to talk excitedly, telling Damian about the songs they sang in church and how moved he was by the experience. He asks Damian if he's ever felt that way before, and if he ever thinks about God or faith.

Damian is taken aback by Jon's enthusiasm, but tries to keep his composure. "I don't really think about that kind of thing," he says coolly.

But Jon presses on, talking about the love and acceptance he's found in his faith community, and how he hopes his parents will come to know that too. "I just feel like there's something bigger than us out there, you know? And I want to be a part of it."

Damian doesn't know how to respond, feeling a strange mix of curiosity, annoyance, and maybe even a little envy. He had always been taught to value self-reliance and discipline, not to depend on some higher power for guidance and strength.

But hearing the earnestness in Jon's voice, he can't help but wonder if there might be something to it after all. Maybe he's been missing out on something important. He decides to keep an open mind and explore this more.

Before he can say anything, there's a knock on the door and one of the other Titans calls for Damian to join them in the training room. "Gotta go, Jon," he says, trying to hide his disappointment. "Take care of yourself, okay?"

Jon says goodbye and hangs up, feeling a little deflated but still grateful for the chance to share his thoughts with his friend. As the call ends, he wonders what Damian is really thinking, and whether he might one day come to share Jon's faith.

Damian heads to the training room with the other Titans, but he has to sit out because of his broken nose. As the others begin to train, he watches them, feeling a mix of frustration and envy. He had always been one of the most skilled and capable fighters among the team, but now he was stuck on the sidelines, unable to fully participate.

As he watches the others spar, Damian begins to think about Jon's phone call. He had been surprised when Jon had called him, and even more surprised by the depth of his questions and his genuine interest in faith. Damian had never been one for religion, seeing it as something weak and superstitious. But as he watches his teammates train, he begins to wonder if there might be something more to it.

Despite his reservations, Damian finds himself drawn to Jon's sincerity and his unwavering belief. He starts to think about the conversations they had had in the past, about how Jon had never given up on him even when he had pushed him away. Maybe there was something to this faith thing after all, he thinks to himself.

Lost in thought, Damian doesn't even notice when the others finish their training and start to leave the room. It's not until Beast Boy nudges him on the shoulder that he snaps out of it.

"You alright, man?" Beast Boy asks, looking at him with concern.

Damian nods, but he can feel the weight of his doubts and uncertainties weighing heavily on him. He knows he can't ignore them forever, but he's not sure he's ready to face them either.

Have beast boy up beat and pleasant, having dialog that is him cracking jokes (consistent with his character), and then have DAmian be reserved and Beast Boy to continue to dialog with him to draw him out. Then have Damian ask Beast Boy questions about his faith upbrining and faith journey so far

Beast Boy and Damian made their way to the training room. Beast Boy was being his usual cheerful self, cracking jokes and making Damian chuckle despite himself.

As they arrived, Beast Boy started to change into a gorilla, but Damian stopped him. "I can't train today," he said, gesturing to his broken nose.

Beast Boy's face fell. "Oh man, that sucks. But hey, it could be worse. You could have broken your leg or something. A broken nose will heal in no time."

Damian just shrugged, not feeling up to Beast Boy's brand of cheerfulness. But Beast Boy didn't seem to pick up on that and continued to chat away, trying to draw Damian out of his shell.

After a few minutes, Damian finally spoke up. "Beast Boy, can I ask you something?"

"Sure, dude. What's up?"

"What was your faith upbringing like? I know your mom is a famous actress and your dad was a scientist, but what about your faith journey?"

Beast Boy looked taken aback for a moment before a serious expression crossed his face. "Oh, uh, well, my mom was actually a pretty devout Christian. I went to church with her growing up and learned a lot about God and Jesus. But then she passed away when I was young, and my dad wasn't really into that stuff, so I kinda drifted away from it for a while."

Damian listened intently, and Beast Boy continued. "But then when I was a teenager, I started to feel like something was missing. I was hanging out with some friends who were Christians and I started to feel drawn back to God. I started going to church again, and it just felt right, you know? I found a community that was really supportive and it's been a big part of my life ever since."

Damian nodded thoughtfully. "I see. I've been thinking a lot about faith lately, but I'm not sure where to start. It all seems so confusing."

Beast Boy grinned. "Well, you came to the right person! I'd be happy to answer any questions you have and maybe even introduce you to some of my friends at church."

Damian looked surprised but also intrigued. "I might take you up on that," he said quietly.

Beast Boy clapped him on the back. "Anytime, man. We're all in this together."
